body_html:
Apparently there is something consuming your GPU memory (Total memory: 11.92GiB Free memory: 11.52GiB) making unavailable the amount TensorFlow is trying to allocate, "failed to allocate 11.92G".

You can set how much memory TensorFlow will have available for use with tf.GPUOptions

gpu_options = tf.GPUOptions(per_process_gpu_memory_fraction=0.333)  #define amount of GPU memory

sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(gpu_options=gpu_options))

For instance if you have 12GB, ~4GB will be allocated for TensorFlow.
Your other option is to use a NVidia SMI to see where your memory is going.

You can set how much memory TensorFlow will have available for use with tf.GPUOptions
gpu_options = tf.GPUOptions(per_process_gpu_memory_fraction=0.333)  #define amount of GPU memory

sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(gpu_options=gpu_options))

body:
Apparently there is something consuming your GPU memory (`Total memory: 11.92GiB
Free memory: 11.52GiB`) making unavailable the amount TensorFlow is trying to allocate, "`failed to allocate 11.92G`". 

You can set how much memory TensorFlow will have available for use with [tf.GPUOptions](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GPUOptions)
```
gpu_options = tf.GPUOptions(per_process_gpu_memory_fraction=0.333)  #define amount of GPU memory

sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(gpu_options=gpu_options))
```
For instance if you have 12GB, ~4GB will be allocated for TensorFlow.
Your other option is to use a NVidia SMI to see where your memory is going.
